intro: Bulbophyllum chlororhopalon, commonly known as the green-veined orchid, is a species of orchid native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and striking, often greenish or yellowish flowers with prominent veining. The plant typically grows on trees or rocks, exhibiting an epiphytic lifestyle. Its leaves are usually broad and fleshy, adapted for storing water in its native humid environments. The flowers are usually fragrant and bloom during the warmer months, attracting various pollinators.
